subject: Re: Apple pay/Google pay
preview: Hi Erin,  Yes, that's correct, WooPayments does require a Stripe account to be set up. However, if your intention is solely to enable Apple Pay and Google Pay, you don’t need to switch your entire c

full_threads.body:
Hi Erin,

Yes, that's correct, WooPayments does require a Stripe account to be set up. However, if your intention is solely to enable Apple Pay and Google Pay, you don’t need to switch your entire credit card processing to Stripe.

In this case, I’d recommend using the WooCommerce Stripe Gateway plugin instead of WooPayments. With this setup:
  • You can enable Apple Pay and Google Pay via Stripe.
  • Your existing credit card facility through Cybersource will remain untouched and continue functioning as it currently does.

This ensures that only Apple Pay and Google Pay transactions are routed through Stripe, while all other card payments go through your current provider.

Let me know how you'd like to proceed, we're ready to assist as soon as you give the go-ahead.

Hi Joel,

I'm looking at the WooPayments for us today and I've hit a point with the setup that I just need to check before we go any further…

It seems to be wanting us to setup a Stripe account, is that right? To my knowledge, we are only wanting to setup Apple Pay and Google Pay, and we want to keep our credit card facility unchanged from what we have now. If we setup a Stripe account will our current credit card facility continue or will it force us to send all payment types through WooPayments/Stripe now?

If that is the case I just need Lee to understand that before we go any further.

Thanks

Erin Skinner TOTAL EYECARE SUPPORT GROUP

Administration Manager



Total Eyecare Support Group

18 Magnet Court, Sandy Bay TAS 7005

P: 03 6231 5744 E: accounts@totaleyecare.com.au

totaleyecare.com.au

Hi Erin,

Could you ladies set that up for us as per Joels advice here?

Thanks
Lee

Hi Lee,

Hope you’re doing well!

Just a quick update - we're currently waiting on someone from your team to set up the WooPayments account. If it's already been created, you can complete the setup by following this link:
Connect WooPayments to Your Store

It just requires a few basic details like your business info and bank account. Once that's done, we can enable it on the site.

Once activated, customers using compatible devices will see options like “Buy with Apple Pay” or “Checkout with Google Pay” at checkout, depending on their device.

Let me know if you need help with anything.

Hi Joel,
IS this one going yet?

Thanks
Lee

Hi Lee,

Great, sounds like a plan!

We may need you or someone on your team to quickly set up the WooPayments account and connect it (just a few basic details like business info and bank account). Once that’s done, we can enable it on the site.

And yes once it’s active, customers on compatible devices will see Apple Pay or Google Pay options right at checkout. It’ll say things like “Buy with Apple Pay” or “Checkout with Google Pay” depending on their device.

Hey Joel,

OK, those fees are a bit higher than our ANZ but not dramatically so. Lets try it for a bit.

Happy for you to flick it on when you like. There will be icons showing at checkout, :checkout with applepay" "checkout with google pay"?

Lee:)

Hi Lee,

Not quite, with WooPayments, ANZ isn’t involved in the online payments anymore. Everything goes through WooPayments, so you’d just pay WooPayments’ fee per transaction. The funds still get deposited into your ANZ account, but ANZ wouldn’t charge you merchant fees for those online sales.

If you're concerned about covering the fees, some stores add a small surcharge at checkout to offset transaction costs.

Hi Joel, Im trying to email woocommerce but cant seem to...

So from the pricing snapshot there then, it seems this would cost us the merchant fee currently charged by ANZ plus the fee per transaction from WooCommerce? Is that right?

Lee

Hi Lee,

All transaction fees for Apple Pay and Google Pay through WooPayments are handled by WooPayments/Stripe. You will see their transaction fees clearly outlined in WooPayments settings. ANZ will not charge any extra fees for processing these payments since they are not involved in the transaction itself.

However, it doesn't hurt to check with ANZ if you want complete peace of mind or if you have any special banking arrangements.

Cool, so i should check with anz re transaction costs, or it is just the same??

Lee

Hi Lee,

I hope you are doing well.

Yes, we have set this up before.

We don't use woopayments, but I have installed this to the site and ready for you to setup.
https://totalcontacts.com.au/wp-admin/admin.php?page=wc-admin&path=%2Fpayments%2Fconnect

Let me know if you need assistance on setting this up.

Hi Joel,
Just looking a bit at the option of incorporating apple pay and Google pay for easier customer checkouts at their end. I like to use Apple pay when shopping, is super fast skipping entering credit card and delivery address details.

Do u have experience setting this up for woocommerce sites?

Looks likes it very simple (this from woocommerce support):

Apologies for my ignorance, but we do use Woopayments, yes?

And they say the transaction fees are same as regular cards:


Can you advise? Looks like theres no reason not to do it? No costs to set up and same ongoing transaction fee we currently pay. Do I needc to speak to ANZ cybersource, our gateway provider?

Thanks
Lee


Lee Baumwol
Optometrist
